content:
# MATH 121 - Linear Algebra

I notice that you're asking about MATH 121, but according to your student profile, you've already taken this course. Nevertheless, here's the course information you requested:

## Course Details
- **Instructor:** John Cain (for Spring 2026)
- **Term:** Spring 2026
- **Overall Rating:** 4.3/5.0 (which is quite good)
- **Workload:** No specific hour data available

## Course Description
This is a second course in linear algebra that emphasizes understanding linear algebra at a more abstract level and focuses on developing proof-reading and proof-writing skills. The course covers:
- Real and complex vector spaces
- Linear transformations
- Eigenvalues and eigenvectors

## Requirements
Anti-requisite: Not to be taken in addition to Mathematics 22a, 23a, 25a, or 55a.

## Student Feedback
Students have generally positive things to say about the course:
- "Very open/exploratory course. You can tell that the instructor REALLY cares about students."
- "Take Math 121 :)"
- Some students noted the course has a looser structure, recommending: "Be sure to hold yourself accountable... it is easy to allow yourself to fall a bit behind."

## Note
Since you've already taken MATH 121 according to your profile, you might want to look into advanced courses that build upon this foundation. Is there something specific about MATH 121 you were trying to find out, or perhaps you're interested in related follow-up courses?

courseData.description: This is a second course in linear algebra, with an emphasis on understanding linear algebra at a more abstract level and learning to read and write proofs. Topics include real and complex vector spaces, linear transformations, and eigenvalues and eigenvectors.
courseData.subject: Mathematics
courseData.course_requirements: Anti-req: Not to be taken in addition to Mathematics 22a, 23a or 25a or 55a.
courseData.recommended_prep: Mathematics 19b or 21b or an equivalent background in mathematics.
courseData.comments: ["Very open/exploratory course. you can tell that Dylan REALLY cares about his students. I walked away from the class learning more about my relationship with math and learning. The class could have been better with more structure but it was what I needed for the semester. It is a very easy going course","Take Math 121 :)","If you take this course, be sure to hold yourself accountable. Because of its looser structure, it is easy to allow yourself to fall a bit behind.","This class is what you make of it – you can do as much or as little as you like to get by. If you do wish to do more, it's certainly possible and can be a great mathematics course in this regard, especially with experience writing proofs.","This is a great intro to proofs! The topics are interesting, but I strongly recommend taking Math 21b beforehand.","This is a very difficult class that is very chill if you want it to be. ONLY take this class if you really want to learn math AND are VERY self–guided.","With Dylan Wilson, there is opportunity to explore if you have the time and motivation. There are no grades, which means that you have to be *really* self–driven to make the class what you want. I did not, and so I feel like I did not get much out of the class. I will be self–studying MIT's 18.06 Linear Algebra class to make up for my lack of foundational linear alg knowledge.\n\nWhen I tried to pset with peers, many politely declined because they valued the class as lower relative to their other classes. Thus, the lack of grading in this class RELATIVE to other classes means that there was a lack of community through struggle (lol). I wish I got to know my peers better!! They seemed like cool people.","This class is much more proof–based than something like Math 21b, and I would recommend having 21b under your belt beforehand, because without it, material in proof format can seem much more confusing. Dylan was great and super helpful, though not sure what this class under another professor would be like.","If you have any interest in upper level mathematics, you should take this class. It will give you all the necessary tools you need to pursue anything else you would choose to in the department.","If Dylan Wilson is teaching this class – take it. Best professor I've had in terms of actually prioritizing learning over completionism. The course material is still a little dry – it's proof–based linear algebra, but Dylan makes up for it.","Dylan is an AMAZING professor. I have never felt safe in a math classroom to inquire and genuinely learn until I took Dylan's class/had him as a professor. He really emphasizes learning to learn instead of for an output (grade). He is also great at explaining difficult concepts, and some things I didn't understand in 21b suddenly clicked in 121. Be wary of who is teaching this though––experience is highly dependent on the instructor.","This class has a ton of flexibility. If you can manage things on your own without outside structure, then take this class! Dylan is super nice and puts an emphasis on learning purely for learning's sake. If you're not great with a lot of flexibility and need external structure, don't take this. It's very self guided, so you won't be able to learn just with what's given.","Take this class; it will definitely expand your understanding in general beyond math.","It is probably not worth your time.","Great class"]

content:
# MATH 121 - Linear Algebra

## Course Details
- **Instructor:** John Cain (Spring 2026)
- **Term:** Spring 2026
- **Overall Rating:** 4.3/5.0 (which is quite good)
- **Workload:** Not specified in available data

## Course Description
This is a second course in linear algebra with an emphasis on understanding linear algebra at a more abstract level. The course focuses on developing proof-reading and proof-writing skills. Topics covered include:
- Real and complex vector spaces
- Linear transformations
- Eigenvalues and eigenvectors

## Requirements
**Anti-requisite:** Not to be taken in addition to Mathematics 22a, 23a, 25a, or 55a.

## Student Feedback
- "Very open/exploratory course. You can tell that the instructor REALLY cares about students."
- "Take Math 121 :)"
- "If you take this course, be sure to hold yourself accountable. Because of its looser structure, it is easy to allow yourself to fall a bit behind."

## Note
According to your student profile, you've already taken MATH 121. If you're looking for information about courses that build upon MATH 121, or if you have specific questions about your experience in the course, I'd be happy to help with that instead.
